displaytitle: Old man with a child (St. Joseph and the Christ Child) playing with lilies in a vase
medium: Pen, dark brown ink and brown and gray-brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

titles.title: Old man with a child (St. Joseph and the Christ Child) playing with lilies in a vase

makers.displaydate: 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy
makers.displaymaker: Guercino (Giovanni Francesco Barbieri), 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy

texts.textentryhtml: Traditionally relegated to the sidelines in scenes of Christ’s infancy, Mary’s husband Joseph became venerated as a saint in his own right during the seventeenth century. In this lyrical drawing by Guercino, Joseph tenderly cradles the Christ Child with one hand while offering him a lily (a symbol of chastity) with the other and looking down solicitously as the baby plays with one of the flowers in the large vase, which anchors the composition.

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: p. 107, no. 306 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)

bibliography.boilertext: David Stone, Guercino, master draftsman: works from North American collections, (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Art Museum; Bologna, Italy: Nuova Alfa Editoriale, 1991).
bibliography.citation: David Stone, Guercino, master draftsman: works from North American collections, (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Art Museum; Bologna, Italy: Nuova Alfa Editoriale, 1991)., 217
